pros: Great training, fair work load. Simply do your job and you'll be fine. LGBT friendly. Management was reliable.

job_title: Licensed Behavioral Health Clinician in Warwick, RI

pros: Rewarding mission; everyone is working as one team towards a common goal (exceptional patient care).
cons: Thundermist Health Center does well to accommodate to their patients. However, a handful of patients' attempt to exploit those assets for their own personal gain. Certain rules and regulations could be more well tailored.

review_title: Rapid Growth has lead to infrastructure weaknesses
pros: Providing care to the medically underserved
cons: Massive growth in a short period of time has led to people advancing to management positions that they do not have the experience or aptitude to be successful in.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Woonsocket, RI
pros: My coworkers are incredible. They help support one another often. I often feel as though I can be myself both with colleagues and patients. The clinic is high stress and a lot of vicarious trauma so it takes some adjusting to. The organization is trying to improve and has a ways to go.
cons: Upper leadership needs to listen to the people on the ground or they will lose all their staff

pros: Teamwork is great. Most people are there for the right reasons and want to help patients.
cons: Upper and middle management really out of touch with what day to day operations are like. The frequent turnover of nursing managers is really difficult as a staff member. Good managers leave because they are overworked.

job_title: Medical Assistant in West Warwick, RI

cons: Management plays favorites; requires unfavorable hours; low pay, compared to same position at other practices; often don’t get a lunch break

job_title: Medical Receptionist in West Warwick, RI

cons: Could use more holidays off and be recognized for employees.

pros: Great atmosphere, people are amazing! Teamwork spirit here is second to none.
